title: multiple boot on 1 cd/dvd/usb (ERD2005, UBCD4WIN, Hiren's, Acronis TrueImage)

forumNotes.author: damasko
forumNotes.content:
Hello, I am novice on this field, so please be comprehensive ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)  
I'd want to build a mutiboot cd/dvd/usb in which put every winpe/dos/linux live os.  
I don't care if this could be done using ramdisk (I don't know what really it is) or not, or if ramdisk has limitations or incompatibilities using some live os build, for example usb hotplug.  
For sure, using usb flash device the best way is to mount images in ramdrive, due to low reading speed on many single files against one big one.  
Another approach is to use virtual machine, but how they interface with host system? I'd need to work on host drives and os.  
I'm looking for some explanation, or even way to find them, about theese arguments ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)  
Thanks in advance!
